While many know orcas as “killer whales,” they are actually the largest species of dolphin. These powerful animals hunt together in pods to take down seals, sharks, and even true whales. Adult orcas are typically 15–25 feet long and weigh 8,000–12,000 pounds. **[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 20 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 15 [Orca](/Monsters.aspx?ID=619) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 84 2.0 **Perception** +12; aquatic echolocation 120 feet, [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=23) **Languages** **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +14, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +13 **Str** +7 **Dex** +2 **Con** +5 **Int** -4 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +0 **Aquatic Echolocation** An orca can use its hearing as a [precise sense](/Rules.aspx?ID=411) at the listed range, but only underwater.
**Deep Breath** An orca can hold its breath for 2 hours. --- **AC** 21 **Fort** +14 **Ref** +11 **Will** +12 **HP** 75 --- **Speed** swim 60 feet **Melee** jaws +13, **Damage** 2d8+9 piercing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) **[Aquatic Ambush](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=2)** 30 feet. An orca can travel no further than 5 feet onto land as part of an Aquatic Ambush. After it does so, it is [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31) until it [Crawls](/Actions.aspx?ID=76) to return to the water. **Breach** The orca [Swims](/Actions.aspx?ID=39) up to its swim Speed, then [Leaps](/Actions.aspx?ID=81) vertically out of the water up to 25 feet in the air, making a Strike against a creature at any point during the jump (this lets it attack a creature within 30 feet of the water's surface). After the Strike, the orca splashes back down into the water.
